criteria: Heading markup is used for content fashioned as headings.
Coded headings consist solely of content which governs a main body of text.
tags: headings, heading, content, structure

criteria: A rational order has been imposed on heading levels.
tags: headings, heading, content, structure

criteria: H1 is placed directly before the unique page content, and signifies the main content heading
tags: headings, heading, content, structure

criteria: Subordinate text follows heading markup rather than being encompassed by it.
tags: headings, heading, content, structure

criteria: Headings are illustrative and exact.
tags: headings, heading, content, structure

criteria: There is a page title for every page, even those inside frames.
tags: headings, heading, content, titles, structure

criteria: Apart from the outcomes of user searches, all page titles are unique.
tags: headings, heading, content, titles, structure

criteria: Page titles illustrate the theme or objective of the page.
tags: headings, heading, content, titles, structure

criteria: Where possible, the document title should match the page title
tags: headings, heading, content, titles, structure

criteria: Data tables are applied properly in situations where tabular layout is necessary for the comprehension of data.
tags: data, tables, tabular data, structure

criteria: Distinct cells are used in data tables for separate data items.
tags: data, tables, tabular data, structure

criteria: TH elements are properly used to mark up simple data table headers.
tags: data, tables, tabular data, structure

criteria: Fitting SCOPE, ID and HEADERS markup are used in complex data tables.
tags: data, tables, tabular data, structure

criteria: The proper usage of SUMMARY attributes and/or CAPTION elements is effected.
tags: data, tables, tabular data, structure

criteria: List elements OL, UL and DL are solely employed in the relevant lists.
tags: Lists, blockquotes, structure, strong, emphasis, structure

criteria: List markup is employed wherever elements are displayed in a visual list.
tags: Lists, blockquotes, structure, strong, emphasis, structure

criteria: BLOCKQUOTE and CITE elements are solely employed for use in quotations.
tags: Lists, blockquotes, structure, strong, emphasis, structure

criteria: BLOCKQUOTE elements are employed wherever citations are quoted.
tags: Lists, blockquotes, structure, strong, emphasis, structure

criteria: Abbreviations are detailed upon either in text or markup, but never text and markup on the same occasion.
tags: Lists, blockquotes, structure, strong, emphasis, structure

criteria: EM or STRONG elements are employed for the purposes of stress.
tags: Lists, blockquotes, structure, strong, emphasis, structure

criteria: Important emphasis conveyed by EM or STRONG elements is also conveyed by text.
tags: Lists, blockquotes, structure, strong, emphasis, structure

criteria: Skip links or provided structure can be used to skip sections of recurring text.
tags: Navigation, skip links, links, structure

criteria: Where skip links are used, they function correctly and are visible, or become visible on tab focus.
tags: Navigation, skip links, links, structure

criteria: Multiple means of travelling from one web page to another are given.
tags: Navigation, skip links, links, structure

criteria: Sections for navigation that recur on more than one Web page appear in an identical relative order whenever they are employed, except when the adjustment is introduced by the user.
tags: Navigation, skip links, links, structure

criteria: The minimum threshold is reached by contrast ratios or else a style switch choice with satisfactory contrast is given.
tags: Foreground, background, colour, color, color contrast, design

criteria: Either background and text have their colour specified, or neither do.
tags: Foreground, background, colour, color, color contrast, design

criteria: Both text and background colour is specified in an identical manner: either both in CSS or HTML.
tags: Foreground, background, colour, color, color contrast, design

criteria: A block background colour is used for images of text.
tags: Foreground, background, colour, color, color contrast, design

criteria: Pictures in the background proffer a satisfactory contrast to foreground content.
tags: Foreground, background, colour, color, color contrast, design

criteria: It is feasible to change the size of text up to twice its original proportions, either using browser controls, or with means provided by the site or application.
tags: Text, text sizing, resizing, design

criteria: It is possible to change the size of text up to twice its original proportions with no cropping, shortening, overlapping, and without losing any information.
tags: Text, text sizing, resizing, design

criteria: Text used in links is differentiated from plain text with a line underneath or other fashioning as well any change in colour.
tags: Navigation, skip links, links, design

criteria: Clear keyboard focus indicators are used for all links.
tags: Navigation, skip links, links, design

criteria: Clear keyboard focus indicators are used for all form controls.
tags: Navigation, skip links, links, design

criteria: The clickable area of a link has been made as large as possible within the design i.e. padding has been put on the a-tag rather than a margin when spacing out the navigation.
tags: Navigation, skip links, links, design

criteria: It is possible to take away CSS styling without the structure and sequence of the information losing its sense.
tags: Layout, mark up, order, ordering, reading order, design

criteria: It is possible to linearise layout tables without the structure and sequence of the information losing its sense.
tags: Layout, mark up, order, ordering, reading order, design

criteria: There are no data table elements nor attributes in layout tables.
tags: Layout, mark up, order, ordering, reading order, design

criteria: There are illustrative title attributes for frames.
tags: Iframes, frames, design

criteria: There are illustrative title attributes for IFRAME elements.
tags: Iframes, frames, design

criteria: There is alternative text for all linked images which briefly and precisely describes the end location of the link.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: There is alternative text for all informative images which precisely transmits the same information.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: There is alternative text for all images of text which precisely reproduces the visible text.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: There are empty ALT attributes for images that are solely ornamental, not visible or for the purposes of formatting only.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: There is alternative text briefly determining the image and the placement of its long description for all complex images.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: There are long descriptions transmitting the same data that is transmitted by the image for all complex images.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: LONGDESC attributes are employed fittingly and correctly.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: There are fitting ALT attributes for all groups of images transmitting an individual piece of data, such as rating stars.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: Background images are solely employed as ornamentation OR reproduce pre-existing data from the text.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: Images of text are solely employed in cases when a similar effect could not be reached by fashioning the text.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: It is possible to use style switching functionality in the place of images of text.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media

criteria: There is alternative text for all image map images which gives a correct context for the AREA elements of the map.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, image maps

criteria: There is alternative text correctly detailing the end location of links for image map AREA elements.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, image maps

criteria: Redundant text links are provided for image map hotspots.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, image maps

criteria: For audible or visual media with a duration of over three seconds, there is either a pause mechanism at the top of the page, or the media is static when the page is initially opened.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: There is a text substitute for audio only that gives illustrative description of the audio as a minimum requirement.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: There is a text substitute for informative audio that performs the same role as the information on the audio.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: Audio employed as the text's alternative is visibly shown to be such, and only holds data which can be found in the primary text.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: It is possible for the user to pause, stop, or conceal any automatically starting video that has a duration of over five seconds, on a web page that includes other content.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: There is a text alternative to a video with no audio that has an illustrative description of the video as a minimum requirement.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: There is a text substitute for video with no audio that performs the same role as the information on the video.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: There are synchronised captions in multimedia for any audio content.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: Captions are entire, lacking no speech or pertinent audio effects.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: There are synchronised audio descriptions in multimedia of visual data, or else a transcription of the entire content.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: Audio description or text alternatives are entire, missing no visual information evident in the video.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: Captions are provided for all live audio content in synchronised media.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: Audio description is provided for all prerecorded video content in synchronised media.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: There is full text transcription for multimedia which transmits both audio and video information.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: Links to alternative media have clear labels and are placed in front of embedded media, or next to links initianting media players.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: When multimedia is used as an alternative to text conten, it is visibly shown to be such, and solely holds information present in the primary content.
tags: Non-text content, non-text, images, media, audio, video

criteria: Label text is correct and renders the control purpose or required input evident.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: Labels are appropriately placed.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: Form labels are clearly connected with their relevant form fields.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: Groups of controls which are connected visually have labels that denote the necessary input for every field.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: The context or connection between groups of form controls is denoted successfully.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: Links leading to help or additional information are positioned before, rather than within, explicit labels.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: Instructions for completing forms are clear and complete.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: Instructions for completing or correcting forms and form fields are positioned before the first, or related, field.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: Suggestions for correct format are made when input must be in a specific format.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links

criteria: Error notification is clearly associated with the relevant field or fields in error.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: Mandatory fields without input are identified and described in text.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: Mandatory fields should use both the html5 required attribute and the Aria-required attribute to ensure the in-built browser validation is accessible. The latter should be set to "true"
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: Fields with incorrect data formats are identified in text and suggestion for correct format is made
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: Form errors are denoted by a heading (h2) and the errors themselves are in an unordered list
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: Data entered by the user is checked for input errors and the user is given an opportunity to make corrections.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: A mechanism is available for reviewing, confirming, and correcting information before finalising the submission.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: Submissions are reversible.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation, submission

criteria: CAPTCHA challenges have a text description and consist of or include a text (form) challenge, or have adjacent contact information to obtain human help to pass or bypass the challenge.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation, captcha

criteria: Form controls are device independent.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: Questions on forms that make it necessary for users to be in possession of particular sensory characteristics are either voluntary or offer assistance for disabled users to effectively complete the form.
tags: forms, labels, inputs, groups, links, errors, validation

criteria: Default language is defined for all pages by accurate values provided in the LANG attribute of the HTML element.
tags: Language, text, content

criteria: When the language changes within a web page it is denoted with the correct use of the LANG attribute, apart from proper names and terms taken into the primary language for the page.
tags: Language, text, content

criteria: The role of active components can be determined.
tags: Focus, role, aria-roles, labels, buttons, links, keyboard, controls

criteria: The visible value of non-text active components and the value exposed to access technologies include a matching term.
tags: Focus, role, aria-roles, labels, buttons, links, keyboard, controls

criteria: Labels, links and buttons with the same function in different Web pages are labelled consistently.
tags: Focus, role, aria-roles, labels, buttons, links, keyboard, controls

criteria: Keyboard focus order is logical through all interactive elements on web pages.
tags: Focus, role, aria-roles, labels, buttons, links, keyboard, controls

criteria: Keyboard navigation through tree controls is logical and intuitive.
tags: Focus, role, aria-roles, labels, buttons, links, keyboard, controls

criteria: All links have text content. ALT text on linked images counts as link text.
tags: links, alt text, images, navigation

criteria: The destination of links is made clear by link text, or link text that is given context by related content.
tags: links, alt text, images, navigation

criteria: Links to different destinations have unique link text.
tags: links, alt text, images, navigation

criteria: Where links open new windows, warnings are provided within or before the link.
tags: links, alt text, images, navigation

criteria: Links to non-HTML format files include, or are preceded by, notification of the destination file format and file size.
tags: links, alt text, images, navigation

criteria: Adjacent image and text links are combined in one link anchor, without creating repetition.
tags: links, alt text, images, navigation

criteria: Abbreviations within links and labels are expanded in markup.
tags: links, text

criteria: Link text is free of symbols that are exposed to screen readers.
tags: Links, text, symbols, icons

criteria: Any content containing motion present in web pages that also have static content either has a duration of five seconds or fewer or can be stopped or concealed by the user.
tags: moving, blinking, content, flashing, media, video, carousels, UI features, animation

criteria: Moving, blinking or scrolling content that is meant to be read can be paused and restarted.
tags: moving, blinking, content, flashing, media, video, carousels, UI features, animation

criteria: Flashing content is slower than 3 flashes per second.
tags: moving, blinking, content, flashing, media, video, carousels, UI features, animation

criteria: The size of flashing content is too small to cause seizures.
tags: moving, blinking, content, flashing, media, video, carousels, UI features, animation

criteria: The user can disable or change the time limit if an automatic TIMEOUT occurs, or else is notified before the time runs out and can make it longer.
tags: media, video, audio, interacton, carousels, UI features, animation, controls

criteria: If content is auto-updated, unless the auto-updating is part of an activity where it is essential, users can stop or control updates.
tags: media, video, audio, interacton, carousels, UI features, animation, controls, content

criteria: If an essential auto-update occurs, users are notified of the updates in a way compatible with assistive technology.
tags: media, video, audio, interacton, carousels, UI features, animation, controls, content

criteria: If a whole or part page automatic REFRESH occurs the user is able to adjust or turn off the timing of the refresh
tags: media, video, audio, interacton, carousels, UI features, animation, controls, content

criteria: Client-side redirects use instant META refresh rather than scripting.
tags: media, video, audio, interacton, carousels, UI features, animation, controls, content

criteria: If a timed automatic REDIRECT occurs the user is able to turn off or adjust the time limit, or is warned and can extend the time.
tags: media, video, audio, interacton, carousels, UI features, animation, controls, content

criteria: There's no keyboard trap.
tags: Non-html, keyboard, constructs, objects, interfaces

criteria: Inaccessible functional embedded objects, interfaces and applets are preceded by a link to an accessible alternative that serves the same purpose.
tags: Non-html, keyboard, constructs, objects, interfaces

criteria: Informative objects, interfaces and applets can be read by access technology, or have a text alternative that serves the same purpose.
tags: Non-html, keyboard, constructs, objects, interfaces

criteria: Items and components employed as ornamentation, formatting, or are Invisible, cannot be viewed by assistive technology.

criteria: Interactive components are all device independent, or provide an alternative mechanism for keyboard control.
tags: Non-html, keyboard, constructs, objects, interfaces

criteria: Interactive components within any interface are accessed in a meaningful order.

criteria: Label text or name values make the purpose of active components or required input clear.

criteria: The role and state of active components can be programmatically determined.

criteria: The focus state of active components can be visually determined.

criteria: Information that is revealed on mouse action, is also made visible on keyboard action.

criteria: Downloadable file content has structural styles or tags rather than purely visual structure.

criteria: Foreground and background colours in downloadable files provide sufficient contrast.

criteria: Interactive elements within downloadable files can be reached and activated by both keyboard and mouse.

criteria: Interactive elements within downloadable files can be recognised both visually and by screen readers.

criteria: Visual tests or exercises that must be presented in non-text format have descriptive text alternatives.
tags: non-text, text, images, alt-text

criteria: Non-text content designed to create a specific sensory experience has descriptive text alternatives.
tags: non-text, text, images, alt-text

criteria: Links and form controls can be reached and activated by keyboard navigation, as well as mouse action.
tags: scripts, scripting, JavaScript, events

criteria: Information that is revealed on mouse action is also revealed on keyboard action.
tags: scripts, scripting, JavaScript, events, mouse, touch, keyboard

criteria: Script event handlers allow keyboard tab key navigation to pass through links and controls without trapping the focus or spontaneously invoking an event.
tags: scripts, scripting, JavaScript, events, mouse, touch, keyboard

criteria: Scripted additions to pages use functions of the DOM to create new content.
tags: scripts, scripting, JavaScript, events, mouse, touch, keyboard

criteria: Scripted links can be recognised by screen readers as links.

criteria: Scripted controls and elements that accept user input are identified by names that describe their purpose.

criteria: The role, state and value of scripted form controls are revealed to assistive technology.

criteria: Cursor focus is set by user action or browser behaviour rather than client-side script.
tags: scripts, scripting, JavaScript, events, focus, forms

criteria: SELECT elements that cause context change have submit buttons rather than OnChange events.

criteria: The user is forewarned of any change of context, such as new window opening, that will result from a page load.

criteria: Focus on an element doesn't cause any change of context, such as new window opening, immediate change of focus or form submission.

criteria: Users are notified in advance of any alteration of context, for example form submission or a new window opening, which will be caused by user input.

criteria: Forms can be submitted without support for client-side script.

criteria: Important links work in the absence of client-side script.

criteria: Where client-side script is used to generate important information, an alternative route to the same information is available.

criteria: Information conveyed by colour difference is also available in text.
tags: color, colour, text

criteria: Patterns as well as colour difference is used to convey information in visual presentations.

criteria: If attributes discernible by the senses are referred to, such as location or appearance, an alternative text or structural method of denoting them is provided.
tags: color, colour, text

criteria: Variations of text formatting that convey information, have text alternatives.
tags: color, colour, text

criteria: HTML documents have a valid DOCTYPE.

criteria: HTML documents have a valid Character Encoding specification (often CHARSET).

criteria: Elements are properly nested.
tags: markp, html, validation

criteria: Start and end tags are complete and correct for the DOCTYPE.
tags: markp, html, validation

criteria: ID attributes have unique values.

tags: markp, html, validation, attributes

tags: markp, html, html5, validation, JavaScript
